jobDescription: EBMUD Job Title: Supervising Construction Inspector (Facilities)Salary Info: $120,156 - $139,104 Annually, Plus Excellent Benefits + RetirementOpens online at www.ebmud.com/jobs on Monday, June 18, 2018Online applications must be received by 4:30 p.m., Friday, July 6, 2018Internal Reference # 18-074A Supervising Construction Inspector plans, coordinates, organizes, directs and supervises the work of Construction Inspectors and Senior Construction Inspectors engaged in inspecting treatment plant, facility, and infrastructure construction work performed by contractors and East Bay Municipal Utility District’s (EBMUD’s) construction crews. The Supervising Construction Inspector has authority to reject materials that do not conform to plans and specifications, and to alter plans to meet field contingencies within specified limits. The position requires considerable initiative, independent judgment, and good communication skills.Typical responsibilities may include:Selecting, training, coaching, assigning, reviewing, supervising, and evaluating construction inspection staff.Assigning inspectors to projects to ensure there are sufficient inspection resources to complete inspections in a timely and thorough manner.Determining work is constructed in compliance with plans and specifications.Performing a constructability review of EBMUD plans and specifications to check special project constraints, conformance to codes, construction methods, equipment, standards, workmanship, quantity, and quality of materials involved in the project.Preparing and reviewing cost estimates.Conferring with inspection, engineering personnel, and the contractor’s field representatives regarding work or materials that deviate from plans and obvious neglect of proper safety precautions.Ensuring that line grade and location have been established and followed during construction.Maintaining computerized records, preparing complete and accurate records and reports; writing memos, letters, and other correspondence as required.Performing construction management and inspection duties.Coordinating and performing field marking of underground utilities, and coordinating and performing site inspections of third-parties working near EBMUD buried facilities.The salary range is $10,013 per month increasing to $10,514, $11,040, and $11,592 after 6, 18, and 30 months, respectively.EBMUD offers an excellent benefits program that includes: paid vacation, holidays and sick leave; family health insurance coverage; family dental and vision care plans; retirement plan (reciprocal with CalPERS); 401(k), 401(a) and 457(b) tax-deferred retirement plans; transit subsidy; tuition reimbursement; and opportunities for professional growth including training and career development.Requirements:Completion of the twelfth grade or the equivalent; ANDThree years of journey level field employment experience in inspecting and approving construction work at a level comparable to or higher than EBMUD’s classification of Construction Inspector.Valid California driver’s license with a satisfactory driving recordMust possess the physical characteristics to perform the critical and important duties of the job including physical agility to climb into trenches and to the top of equipment, tanks, and other structures. Must be willing to work outdoors in a variety of conditions including in confined spaces. Must be willing to work long and unusual hours when the situation demands it and work overtime as needed. May be required to travel outside of the immediate area on overnight in-plant inspection trips.Submit a completed EBMUD application and the required supplemental question responses online at www.ebmud.com/jobs by 4:30 p.m., Friday, July 6, 2018. Only application materials submitted online during the filing period will be accepted.EBMUD is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabilitywww.ebmud.comJob Hotline: (510) 287-0742
